section: Distributor shall report promptly and in writing to Accuray any complaints or expressions of dissatisfaction by the Customers to Distributor relating to the Products or Services. Any such reports shall be provided to Accuray via electronic mail to the following address: complaints@accuray.com.
explanation: This section describes the manner in which complaints should be reported to Accuray. However, there is no guarantee that Accuray will respond or take action based on these complaints.

section: To purchase Products or Services based on a Quote provided by Accuray, Distributor will issue a purchase order, which shall include specific references to the quote number of such Quote (the "Purchase Order"). Accuray shall either accept or reject such Purchase Order within two weeks after receipt thereof, with any failure to approve or disapprove of such Purchase Order in such period constituting disapproval.
explanation: The contract states that if Accuray does not respond to the Purchase Order within two weeks then it means that the Purchase Order has been disapproved. This is not clear and can lead to multiple interpretations of the same term. This could be argued in court if this was the case.

section: Accuray shall bear the cost of any bank charges assessed by its bank for a letter of credit and any commission charge for a wire transfer.
explanation: It is not clear if this applies to both parties or not.
